messages.title: Jo Swinson's Plan for Britain's Future
messages.content:
The best start in life: Invest in schools as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.
Economy: End rough sleeping within five years. Give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills & training throughout their lives.
Mental Health Service: Treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

messages.title: It's time to build a brighter future
messages.content: For too many people, things aren't working as they should be. Both the Conservatives and Labour are failing time and again to deliver a better future. The Liberal Democrats' plan for government stands in stark contrast to the dreary offer from the Conservatives or Labour. They want to sever our ties with our closest allies abroad, harking back to the days of empire or 1970s socialism... Only a Liberal Democrat government will offer a proper funding for our NHS and schools - and put an end to the politics of fear and division. So we can build a brighter future for our country.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give Every Child the Best Start in Life

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide free childcare from 9 months to start school and give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills and training.
Treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only a Liberal Democrat government will offer a proper funding for our NHS and schools - and put an end to the politics of fear and division.

issues.brexitEurope: Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
issues.economy: Provide free childcare from 9 months to start school and give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills and training.
issues.education:
Recruit 20,000 more teachers.
Invest in schools as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.
issues.environment: Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.
issues.government: Only a Liberal Democrat government will offer a proper funding for our NHS and schools - and put an end to the politics of fear and division.
issues.health: Treat mental health with the same urgency as physical health.

community.content:
Transform our Mental Health Services.
Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.

endorsements.endorsement: "I firmly believe that Britain is better off in the EU. As a result I have now found a new home within the Liberal Democrats. I am proud to join a progressive party. I left Labour as a direct consequence of the direction in which the party is moving."

"I'm backing the Liberal Democrats because they've led the fight for mental health provision in our NHS. As a psychiatrist I see all too often that mental health is put at the bottom of the pile, behind other illnesses - that has to stop. The Liberal Democrats will transform mental health services, ensuring that mental health is treated with the same urgency as physical health."

"The Conservatives have become a party promoting an extremist view of isolationism. It wasn't an easy decision to leave, but I could no longer campaign for them. The Lib Dems are a proudly internationalist party and the only pro-business party left."

"I've worked in the green industry for 20 years and it's clear to me the Liberal Democrats have the best plan to tackle the climate emergency. We can't afford to wait any longer and I trust Jo Swinson's Liberal Democrats to bring about the changes we all so desperately need."

examples: Invest in schools as part of an extra £10 billion a year for schools.
Provide free childcare from 9 months to start school and give every adult £10,000 to spend on skills and training.
For too many people, things aren't working as they should be.
A choice between two divisive leaders like Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn.
Only a Liberal Democrat government will offer a proper funding for our NHS and schools - and put an end to the politics of fear and division.
The Conservatives have become a party promoting an extremist view of isolationism.
I've worked in the green industry for 20 years and it's clear to me the Liberal Democrats have the best plan to tackle the climate emergency.

Stop Brexit and invest the £50 billion Remain Bonus in public services and tackling inequality.
Generate 80% of our electricity from renewables by 2030 and insulate all low-income homes by 2025.
